overview: The documentary Ciudad Chicha narrates the different stages through which the Peruvian cumbia genre has passed. And the story is told by the same leading musicians of this movement, such as Jaime Moreyra and Julio Simeón (“Chapulín”) from the group Los Shapis, Edilberto Cuestas from Los Ecos, Jorge Rodríguez from Los Mirlos, Humberto “Tito” Caycho from Los Destellos and Rossy War, among others equally outstanding. Their testimonies are commented on by specialists who observe the Peruvian cumbia as a sociocultural phenomenon such as Carlos Iván Degregori, Gonzalo Portocarrero, Rodrigo Montoya and Teófilo Altamirano.
title: Ciudad Chicha
